By the Queene.
Elizabeth R
Whereas we do p

r

s
r
vaunt Tho
m

r
the

w
th
some expedition, to supply the place of our trusty
and welbeloved S
r
vau
n
t
Henry Killegrew
Esq
r
one of our
Cownsell of Estate
there, whome yt
hath pleased us to revoke both for our owen
s
r
vice, and his private busines here Our will and
pleas
r
ys that ye shall see him furnished of able post horse s from place to place for him self his
s
r
vaunts and one guyde betwixt this and the Seaside at reasonable prices. And also to
mitte
and suffer him w
th
his sayed
s
r
vaunts money bag and baggage, and all other their furniture and
necessaries quietly to passe by yow w
th
out eny yo
r
s
r
che staye or interruption, and to be aiding
and assistinge to them in all things convenient for his spedy journey to the seaside and for his
transportac
o
n at the sayed prices. And hereof faile ye not as ye tender our plea
s
r
&
will aunswere to the contrary at yo
r
illes. And these our l
i
es shalbe yo
r
sufficient warraunt
& discharge in this behaulf. Given under our Signet. At So
m
set howse the xx
th
day
of November in the xxxj
th
yere of our reigne.

s

chers, and to all other
